channel.title: Google-Earth-Engine on Philipp Gärtner Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Google-Earth-Engine on Philipp Gärtner Blog

item.title: Earth Engine App - Infos
item.description: Analysis of all available Earth Engine App source codes and aggregated information on what data and modules creators load and which areas they are interested in.

item.title: Use Google's Earth Engine Python API in RStudio
item.description: This blogpost is about RStudio and the reticulate package! Reticulate includes a Python engine for R Markdown that enables easy interoperability between Python and R chunks. This enables us to bring the power of Earth Engine to RStudio.

item.title: Google Earth Engine Apps - Updated 23th December 2020
item.description: All (1395!!) publically available Google Earth Engine Apps, ordered alphabetically by users name.

item.title: Use Google's Earth Engine Python API in RStudio
item.description: This blogpost is about RStudio and the reticulate package! Reticulate includes a Python engine for R Markdown that enables easy interoperability between Python and R chunks. This enables us to bring the power of Earth Engine to RStudio.

item.title: How cloudy is my Sentinel-2 image collection? - The 'QA60' band gives insights
item.description:
In Google Earth Engine we usually load an image collection first and then filter it by a date range, a region of interest and a image property with some cloud percentage estimates.

If the cloud threshold value is set too low it may happen that we throw away (filter out) to many images that could have been useful for our analysis. If we select the filter too generously, too many scenes with clouds remain. Finding a good threshold is not easy, this blog post may help to find it.

item.title: Europe's Air Quality Winner
item.description: A Google Earth Engine App (prototype) to compare European countries NO2 Median changes during the Corona lockdown with the previous year.

item.title: Google Earth Engine App Image Gallery
item.description: A image gallery (ordered alphabetically, by users name) of almost all publicly available Google Earth Engine Apps.

item.title: Use Google Earth Engine in RStudio with reticulate
item.description: A short tutorial on how to use Google Earth Engine inside RStudio with the GEE Python API and reticulate - the R interface to Python.

item.title: Collection of Google Earth Engine management tips
item.description: Since April this year I tweet irregularly about Google Earth Engine management tips. This blogpost unites all tweets on this topic.

item.title: Code behind the Sentinel-2 Ingestion Status App
item.description: I wrote a little Earth Engine App where I compared the data availability of Sentinel-1C (Top of Atmosphere) and Sentinel-2A (Surface Reflectance) within the EE data catalog. This blogpost is about the code behind the App.

item.title: Checking Earth Engine's Sentinel-2 Surface Reflectance ingestion status
item.description: Since the 27<sup>th</sup> of March 2019 has the Earth Engine data catalogue one more dataset. Sentinel-2 Surface Reflectance (Level-2A) data are finally available. This blog post teaches you in one minute, how to get the current Sentinel-2 ingestion status for your country.

item.title: Europe's air pollution is lower during weekends
item.description: TL;DR Europe’s air pollution decreases at weekends and rises again during the working week. The Netherlands is the country with the highest proportion of Nitrogen Dioxide (NO2) in the air - during working days. A Car-Free-Day Saturday in Spain and Portugal did not show a significant improvement in NO2 values compared to other “normal” Saturdays.

item.title: When Landsat-8 (almost) meets Sentinel-2
item.description: How often does Landsat-8 and Sentinel-2 appear at the same location at the same time?! Do both satellites really fly over the same spot somewhere at the same time, sometime? If so, Sentinel-2 should incidentally take photos of the Landsat-8 satellite itself. Well, let the quest for an unlikely image begin.

item.title: This Landsat project would cost...
item.description: LANDSAT COST ESTIMATOR - A tool to estimate the cost of analyzed Landsat imagery if it wasn’t freely available.

item.title: Analysing Google Earth Engine User Summit 2018 tweets
item.description: Today ended the three-day Google Earth Engine User Summit 2018. On social media channels such as Twitter and YouTube, could non-participants indirectly follow the progress and news around the Earth Engine technology.

item.title: Intra-annual vegetation density changes of two public parks in Berlin, Germany
item.description: The blog post shows how the vegetation of two public parks changes seasonally. Multi-temporal satellite images were used to aggregate monthly histograms of vegetation index values.

item.title: Diagnose Earth Engine performance with the profiler
item.description: Google Earth Engine provides with the ‘Profiler’ cloud-computing performance information concerning the resources consumed during script computation.

item.title: European capital greenness evaluation
item.description: The analysis of satellite images from Sentinel-2 shows how green Europe’s capitals really are. The greenness was evaluated with the Normalized Difference Vegetation Index and allows comparison among the 43 analyzed capitals.

item.title: Landsat image inventory in Google Earth Engine
item.description: Welcome, to my first step by step tutorial to investigate Landsat image availability and metadata properties for every country within the Earth Engine.
